channel.title: Endless Ideas
channel.description: Well, I was reading some random stuff on hack-a-day and I got the strange idea that I wanted to build some that ran off my serial ports on a couple of old computers I have laying around, so I Googled some software and found this http://www.rentron.com/x-treme-serial.htm and suddenly got a LOT of ideas of what to do with some basic relays and microcontrollers (I'm really good with electronics). The only problem is I really don't have funding, but if someone wants to see me do something with all this stuff, simply post and I'll see what I can do. I was thinking I could possibly build a computer driven vehicle that I can wirelessly control it from my computer using an access point router.

item.title: Endless Ideas
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Bobby:

the stanford peeps did it and won the contest. this would be simplier

Yes, because RXVL goes to Stanford, is a team of specialized students and faculty, has the capital to make something that looks like this, and can win the Darpa Grand Challenge.

Read full topic

item.description:

Bobby:

I think it would be cool if you did it to a rc car and then gave it ai ( well sort of) so it could go round obdstacles and stuff.

You would need seriously advanced image recognition for that.

item.title: Endless Ideas
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Well, I was reading some random stuff on hack-a-day and I got the strange idea that I wanted to build some that ran off my serial ports on a couple of old computers I have laying around, so I Googled some software and found this http://www.rentron.com/x-treme-serial.htm and suddenly got a LOT of ideas of what to do with some basic relays and microcontrollers (I’m really good with electronics). The only problem is I really don’t have funding, but if someone wants to see me do something with all this stuff, simply post and I’ll see what I can do. I was thinking I could possibly build a computer driven vehicle that I can wirelessly control it from my computer using an access point router.
